title: Scaling a Startup Team
problem: I need to scale my startup team from 5 to 50 people while maintaining culture and productivity.
insight: Base120 identified that scaling isn't just about hiring — it's about chunking the organization into manageable units (CO2), understanding the spatial dynamics of team topology (P13), maintaining cultural homeostasis during rapid change (SY8), and ensuring alignment operates at multiple scales simultaneously (SY15).

title: Strategic Pivot Decision
problem: We have good retention but terrible acquisition. Should we pivot our go-to-market strategy?
insight: Instead of a binary pivot/no-pivot answer, Base120 recommended examining the problem through multiple lenses (P4), identifying which systems archetype is at play — likely "Fixes that Fail" or "Shifting the Burden" (SY5), checking if the retention/acquisition gap is fractal across segments (RE5), and focusing on the 20% of channels driving 80% of results (DE7).

title: Production Crisis
problem: Our database is failing intermittently under load. We've tried adding replicas but the problem keeps coming back.
insight: The API matched this to two workflows immediately. Root Cause Analysis (DE1) prevents symptom-chasing, Premortem (IN2) asks "what if we assume the replicas will also fail?", Pareto (DE7) focuses on which queries cause 80% of the load, and Failure First (IN12) designs for the failure mode rather than the happy path.

title: Founder Burnout
problem: I'm working 80-hour weeks, making every decision myself, and my co-founder just left. How do I survive this?
insight: Base120 reframes burnout as a systems problem, not a willpower problem. First Principles (P1) strips away "founder myths" to ask what actually needs your attention. Empathy Mapping (P5) applied to yourself reveals the gap between what you think you need and what you actually need. Chunking (CO2) breaks the overwhelming whole into survivable pieces. Homeostasis (SY8) identifies which stabilizing loops have broken.

title: AI Agent Coordination
problem: We have 5 different AI agents but they keep duplicating work and contradicting each other. How do we coordinate them?
insight: This is literally the problem HUMMBL was built to solve. Feedback Loops (SY3) identify where agents are amplifying each other's errors. Coordination Protocols (CO5) establish rules of engagement. Stakeholder Mapping (P2) clarifies each agent's role and authority. Multi-Scale Alignment (SY15) ensures local agent decisions serve global objectives.

title: Market Entry
problem: We're a B2B SaaS entering a crowded market with 15+ established competitors. How do we differentiate?
insight: Lens Shifting (P4) reframes "crowded market" as "validated demand." Subtractive Thinking (IN1) asks what features competitors have that customers don't actually want. Narrative Framing (P8) builds a story that positions your absence from the market as intentional timing. Pareto (DE7) identifies the underserved 20% of the market that represents 80% of unmet need.
